response.content:
{
  "step1": "Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour two 9‑inch round cake pans, then set aside. In a large bowl, whisk together 2 ½ cups all‑purpose flour, 2 ½ teaspoons baking powder, ½ teaspoon baking soda, and 1 ½ teaspoons salt to ensure even distribution through the mixing process before adding wet.",
  "step2": "Combine wet ingredients in a separate bowl: beat 1 cup (240 ml) melted butter with 2 cups granulated sugar until light and fluffy, then add 4 large eggs one at a time, mixing well after each. Stir in 2 teaspoons vanilla extract for flavor depth and rich aroma to the batter overall.",
  "step3": "Gradually add the dry flour mixture to the wet butter‑sugar blend, stirring gently with a spatula until just combined. Fold in ¾ cup (180 ml) sour cream for moisture, then incorporate ½ cup (120 ml) whole milk, ensuring a smooth, glossy batter without overmixing or air bubbles that could spoil texture later.",
  "step4": "Prepare the chocolate ganache: melt 8 ounces (225 g) dark chocolate with ½ cup (120 ml) heavy cream over a double boiler, stirring constantly until silky. Add 2 tablespoons unsalted butter, a pinch of sea salt, and whisk until glossy, then set aside to cool slightly before folding into the cake batter.",
  "step5": "Divide the batter evenly between the prepared pans, smoothing tops with a spatula. Bake for 30‑35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center emerges clean with a few moist crumbs. Remove cakes from oven, let cool in pans for 10 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack carefully.",
  "step6": "Once completely cooled, place one layer on a serving plate, spread half of the ganache evenly, then top with the second cake layer. Frost the top and sides with remaining ganache, smoothing with an offset spatula. Garnish with chocolate shavings or fresh berries, slice, and serve to eight delighted guests."
}
